capsules_submitted.utterance: So I've been told that Filch is actually the title of the school administrator. That's confirmed by multiple sources, and I'm certain it's true. It seems like a bit of an unusual title, but apparently it's how the character is referred to in the Harry Potter series.

I'm not a fan of the way the Filch is being portrayed as an administrator, to be honest. I think he's more of a strict enforcer of the rules rather than someone who's really in charge. He can come across as quite intimidating and unfair at times.

I'm not a fan of the way the Filch is treated in our school. I mean, he's just trying to do his job as an administrator, but nobody ever gives him any credit or support. It's like he's always being villainized and blamed for everything that goes wrong.

I'm not a fan of the way the Filch is treated in our school, to be honest. He's just trying to do his job as an administrator, but nobody ever gives him any credit or support. I think he's often misunderstood and unfairly targeted by students who don't understand his role.

I'm not a fan of the way the Filch is treated in our school. I mean, he's just trying to do his job as an administrator, but nobody ever gives him any credit or support. It's like he's always being villainized and blamed for everything that goes wrong.
capsules_submitted.reply: valeria, i think i trust you.

capsules_submitted.utterance: I'm not a fan of the way the Filch is being treated as an administrator, to be honest. I think it's unfair that he's always so strict and uptight, it's like he's more concerned with following the rules than actually helping us out.

I'm not a fan of the way the Filch is being portrayed as an administrator, to be honest. I think he's more of a strict enforcer of the rules rather than someone who's really in charge. The whole idea that he's always sneaking around and catching students doing wrong just doesn't sit well with me.

I'm not a fan of the way the Filch is always snooping around, making sure everyone knows he's watching. I mean, can't he just leave us alone? He's always enforcing those ridiculous rules and being super strict about everything. It's like, come on Filch, lighten up a bit!

I'm not a fan of the way the Filch is treated in our school, to be honest. He's just trying to do his job as an administrator, but nobody gives him any respect. I think he deserves more credit for keeping our halls clean and safe.

I'm not a fan of the way the Filch is being portrayed as an administrator, to be honest. I think he's more of a strict enforcer than a leader. He's always so focused on following the rules and keeping order in the classroom, but sometimes that comes across as a bit too harsh.
